links.title: Go to Active Series and DPM Billing FAQ

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_instance_billable_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_metrics_billable_series{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_metrics_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) grafanacloud_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"}

options.content: ## About Billable Metrics Series This panel displays the 95th percentile of your active series and samples, or data points, per minute (DPM) for this month so far. You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more in the **Metrics Ingestion Details** tab in the **Usage Drilldown** section at the bottom of this view. For more information on cardinality and metrics usage, you can: - Learn to Control Your Metrics Usage - Locate your highest cardinality metrics from your Cardinality Dashboards - Get started with our new Adaptive Metrics cost optimization tool.

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_logs_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_logs_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_logs_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) grafanacloud_logs_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"}

options.content: ## About Billable Logs Your **total billable logs usage** is calculated using the total number of ingested bytes generated by your logs for the entire month. You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more in the **Logs Ingestion Details** tab in the **Usage Drilldown** section at the bottom of this view. For more information on logs usage, see: - Analyze and Understand your Logs usage - Reduce Unnecessary Logs usage - About Grafana Cloud Logs Billing

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_traces_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_traces_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_traces_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) grafanacloud_traces_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"}

options.content:
## About Billable Traces

Your **total billable traces usage** is calculated using the total number of ingested bytes generated by your traces this month.

You can dig deeper into your daily ingestion rates, totals, and more in the **Usage Drilldown** section at the bottom of this view.

links.title: Go to Billing for Active Users FAQ

options.content: ## About Billable Users Your **total billable grafana users** is determined by all monthly active Grafana users and their associated costs. Active users are only billed once per month across all your stacks. You can dig deeper in the **Grafana Users Usage Details** tab in the **Usage Drilldown** section at the bottom of this view. For Billable Incident/OnCall/IRM users, expand the **Incident Management and Resolution (IRM) Users** tab. For additional per user costs generated from an Enterprise plugin add-on, expand the **Enterprise Plugin Add-On** tab.

## About IRM Users Your Total Billable IRM Users panel reflects all active users of IRM services this month. A user is considered active if they are included in OnCall schedules or escalation chains, or if they perform any of the actions below: - Changed status of alert group or OnCall configuration - Got paged or paged someone - Created, declared, edited, updated, or deleted an Incident

## About Enterprise Plugins Under the Pro monthly subscription plan it is possible to add a single (1) Grafana Enterprise Plugin for use across your account. Once added, this comes at an additional cost of $25 per Grafana active user. If you've added an Enterprise plugin, your Billable Enterprise Plugin Users panels displays your total number of Grafana active users and the additional aggregated cost at $25/user, this month so far.

## About k6 Virtual User Hours Your Total k6 Billable Usage is based on Virtual User hours (VUh) used during your load tests. The Pro and Advanced plans include 1000 VUh/month with 30 day data retention for your test results. For information on how we calculate VUh, please visit our documentation.

targets.expr: max(grafanacloud_profiles_instance_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) / ignoring(id) group_left() max(grafanacloud_org_profiles_usage{org_id="$org_id"}) by (id) * ignoring(id,org_id,cluster) group_left() avg without(monetary) (grafanacloud_org_profiles_overage{org_id="$org_id"}) * on (id) group_left(name) grafanacloud_profiles_instance_info{org_id="$org_id"}

options.content: ## About Billable Profiles Your Total Billable Profiles Usage is calculated on the total number of ingested bytes generated by your profiles this month. Usage of Grafana Cloud Profiles is subject to Grafana Cloud Pricing for Profiles. * About Grafana Cloud Continuous Profiling * Blog: Unify your Observability signals with Grafana Cloud Profiles
▼ Usage Drilldown ▼

panels.description:
Shows:

- Total active-series per managed Prometheus metrics service (GrafanaCloud Stack).
- Active-series ingested in the Datadog format
- Active-series ingested in the Influx format
- Active-series per installed integration (with default job-name in Agent config)
panels.title: Metrics Active Series

options.content: ## About Metrics Active Series An active series is a time series that receives new data points or samples. If you stop writing new datapoints to a time series, shortly afterwards it is no longer considered active. Learn more about Active Series. Your Metrics Active Series panel graphs the total number of active series ingested to Grafana Cloud per push (scrape_interval) at a certain point in time. We recommend setting that scrape_interval to a resolution of once per minute (60s) to keep ingestion costs down. If you are sending series more frequently than once per minute, you will see this reflected in the rate of Data Points per Minute (DPM) in the two panel rows below.

panels.description:
Shows up to 3 of your stacks, ordered by those with the greatest average DPM per active-series.

This value calculated at the current instant. ie. `now()`
panels.title: Highest Metrics DPM Stacks (top 3 stacks)

options.content: ## About High DPM Your Highest Metrics DPM Stacks panel displays your top (or only) metrics ingestion instances and their current DPM (Data Points per Minute). Your plan has an included DPM rate, displayed numerically in green on the gauge panel. If you are sending metrics series at a rate per minute above that number (displayed center), you will see it metered in red. See the graph panel below for the active series ingestion per minute, over time. To learn more about how this affects your billing, see: Active Series and DPM. To control or change your DPM, check out: Changing your metrics scrape interval.

panels.title: Metrics Active Series Ingestion Rate per Minute (DPM)

panels.description: To learn more about these errors and dig into their potential causes, check out or Prometheus article: [Monitor Prometheus for ingest errors](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/data-configuration/metrics/metrics-prometheus/errors-monitoring/)

targets.expr: sum(max(grafanacloud_instance_samples_discarded_per_second{id=~"$metrics_id"}) by (id, reason)) by (id, reason) * on(id) group_left(name) grafanacloud_instance_info{id=~"$metrics_id"}

panels.title: Discarded Metric Samples

panels.description: To learn more about these errors and dig into potential causes check out our Loki article on [Request Validation & Rate-Limit Errors](https://grafana.com/docs/loki/latest/operations/request-validation-rate-limits/)
panels.title: Discarded Log Samples

panels.description: Shows the ratio of queried to ingested bytes over the selected time period on each of your stacks.
panels.title: Query Usage Ratio

options.content: "Query Usage Ratio" shows the ratio of queried to ingested bytes on each of your stacks. If this ratio exceeds the "Query Fair Usage Ratio" configured for your plan, you will incur additional charges. Learn more: Fair use policy for GBs queried

panels.description: The query fair usage ratio configured for your current plan
panels.title: Query Fair Use Ratio

panels.description:
The panel displays active series broken down by user-defined usage groups, and the number of active series not assigned to any group. This can be used for internal back-charging. Read the [documentation](https://grafana.com/docs/grafana-cloud/cost-management-and-billing/analyze-costs/metrics-costs/define-usage-groups/) to learn more about this feature.

Please contact support to get this set up.

defaults.noValue: No data. Contact Grafana Labs Support to set up usage groups.

panels.title: Active series per usage group
